H0.text: The Council of Trent in the 16th century was held between believers of what religious faith. Islam

H1.text: The Council of Trent in the 16th century was held between believers of what religious faith. Buddhism

H2.text: The Council of Trent in the 16th century was held between believers of what religious faith. Hinduism

H3.text: The Council of Trent in the 16th century was held between believers of what religious faith. Xty

A4.text: The Council of Trent was the 19th ecumenical council of the Roman Catholic Church.

A5.text: The Council of Trent issued condemnations of heresies committed by proponents of Protestantism.

A6.text: The Council of Trent (1545–1563) became the driving force behind the Counter-Reformation in response to the Protestant movement.

A7.text: The Council of Trent (1545–1563) reaffirmed many central Catholic teachings such as transubstantiation, the keeping of the sacraments, and the requirement of good works anchored in love and hope to justify one's salvation, as well as faith as a necessary condition to attain such salvation.

A8.text: The council, in the Canon of Trent, officially accepted the Vulgate listing of the Old Testament Bible, which included the deuterocanonical works (called apocrypha by Protestants) on a par with the 39 books found in the Masoretic Text.

A9.text: The council also commissioned the Roman Catechism, which served as authoritative Church teaching until the Catechism of the Catholic Church (1992).
